intro: Oldenlandia macrostemon, commonly known as the large-headed spiderwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, Africa, and the Pacific Islands. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with hairy undersides and produces small, white or pinkish flowers clustered in cymes. Its fruit is a dry, three-lobed capsule that disperses seeds through wind. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks.
